agenda.for: After a player researches a technology, they must destroy one of their non-fighter ships.
agenda.against: At the start of the next strategy phase each player exhausts one planet for each technology they have researched.

agenda.for: Elected player draws 1 secret objective.
Each player destroys all but 2 of their dreadnaughts and all but 4 of their cruisers.
agenda.against: At the start of the next strategy phase, each player exhausts each of their planets with a technology specialty.

agenda.for: The elected secret objective becomes a public objective.
Destroy each unit on the planet. It's controller chooses a player with the fewest victory points to place 1 infantry on the planet.
This card may be discarded during a future agenda to choose a player to be elected for an agenda, bypassing the voting process.
Destroy each ground force on the planet. For each unit destroyed, the player who controls that planet gains 1 trade good.
Players cannot use Bombardment against cultural planets. Players who voted 'Against' discard all of their action cards.
Destoy 1 infantry on that planet. It resource value is increased by 2.
Destroy all units on that planet. Player's units cannot land, be produced on or be placed on this planet.
All players discard all trade goods, then draw 5.
agenda.against: All players discard all trade goods.

agenda.for: Players cannot use alpha or beta wormholes.
agenda.against: Destroy each PDS in/adjacent to a wormhole.

agenda.for: All players have a maximum of 3 action cards in hand.
agenda.against: Each player dicards a random action card.

agenda.for: Each player cannot have more than 4 tokens in their fleet pool.
agenda.against: Each player gains 1 command token into their fleet pool.

agenda.for: The planet's controller gains 1VP. Units on this planet cannot use Production.
Each player can have any number of PDS on planets they control.
At the end of the strategy phase this card may be discarded to swap one of this player's strategy cards with 1 of another player's strategy cards.
Draw and reveal an additional stage 1 public objective.
agenda.against: Draw and reveal an additional stage 2 public objective.

agenda.for: The speaker rolls a die. 1-5: Destroy all units on Mecatol Rex & 3 units in each system adjacent to Mecatol Rex. 6-10: Each player researches 2 technologies.
Discard elected law.
After the owner of this card replenishes commodities, they gain a trade good for each player that is their neighbor.
When the owner of this cards gains control of a planet, they gain a trade good.
When the owner of this card places a space dock in a system, their units in that system use Production abilities.
After a player activates a system that contains 1 or more of a different player's units, the owner of this card may discard it to immediately end the active player's turn.
The owner draws an extra action card during the status phase.
When the owner of this card resolves the primary or secondary ability of the Technology Strategy card, they do not need to spend resources.
The owner of this card may discard this card after performing an action to remove one of their command tokens on the board. Then, they may perform an additional action.
Vote on that law again, as if it was revealed.
Each player who voted 'For' gains 1 VP.
agenda.against: Each player who voted 'For' loses 1 VP.

agenda.for: Discard all laws in play. Exhaust all home systems next strategy phase.
The owner of this card applies +1 to their fighter's combat rolls. When the owner of this card uses a Production ability they discard this card unless they produce at least 2 fighters.
Elected player discards all action cards. If they have the speaker token, they pass it to the player on their left. They cannot vote on further agendas during this agenda phase.
If a player has Warsun technology all players may ignore that technology's prerequisites. All warsuns lose sustain damage.
agenda.against: Each player with war sun technology discards all of their action cards.

agenda.for: Each fighter or infantry requires 1 resource instead of 1/2 of a resource to produce.
Players cannot exhaust planets to cast votes during the agenda phase. Each player may cast 1 vote on each agenda.
agenda.against: At the start of the next strategy phase, each player that voted 'Against' exhausts all of his cultural planets.

agenda.for: When this planet's owner researches technology they may exhaust this planet to ignore a green prerequisite.
When this planet's owner researches technology they may exhaust this planet to ignore a yellow prerequisite.
When this planet's owner researches technology they may exhaust this planet to ignore a blue prerequisite.
When this planet's owner researches technology they may exhaust this planet to ignore a red prerequisite.
The player with most VP gains 1 VP.
agenda.against: The player with the fewest VP gains 1 VP.

agenda.for: The influence value of this planet is increased by 2.
This card is worth 1VP. If a player wins a combat against the player that has this card, they gain this card.
Units can move through nebulae.
agenda.against: Each player places a command token in their home system.

agenda.for: Each player destroys half of their infantry (rounded up) on each planet. Each player gains a trade good for each unit they destroyed.
agenda.against: Each player gains 1 infantry on each planet they control.

agenda.for: The influence and resource values of this planet are each increased by 1.
This card is worth 1VP. If a player gains control of a planet in this player's home system they gain this card.
During each round this card's owner may reroll any number of his dice. Any units that reroll but do not produce a hit are destroyed.
Each player that voted 'For' draws 2 action cards.
agenda.against: Each player that voted 'For' discards all of their action cards.

agenda.for: Systems that contain an alpha or beta wormhole are adjacent to each other.
agenda.against: Each player places a command token in each system with one of their ships and either an alpha or beta wormhole.

agenda.for: Each player with a ship in a system with an alpha or beta wormhole destroys all his ships in those systems, then researches a technology.
agenda.against: Each player who voted 'Against' removes a command token from his command sheet.

cultural.effect: Purge 3 of your cultural relic fragments to gain 1 relic.

Return all structures on this planet to your reinforcements. Then, return all ground forces on this planet to the space area. ATTACH: Units cannot be committed to, produced on, or placed on this planet. During the agenda phase, this planet's planet card can be traded as part of a transaction.
This planet's resource value is increased by 2 and its influence value is increased by 1.
You may produce 1 unit in this system; you may spend influence as if it were resources to produce this unit.
Place a gamma wormhole token in this system. Then, purge this card.
You may place 1 infantry from your reinforcements on this planet.
This planet's influence value is increased by 2.
This planet's influence value is increased by 1.

hazardous.effect: If you have at least 1 mech on this planet, or if you remove 1 infantry from this planet, gain 1 trade good.
If you have at least 1 mech on this planet, or if you remove 1 infantry from this planet, ready this planet.
Purge 3 of your hazardous relic fragments to gain 1 relic.
This planet's resource value is increased by 1 and its influence value is increased by 2.
This planet's resource value is increased by 2.
This planet's resource value is increased by 1.
If you have at least 1 mech on this planet, or if you remove 1 infantry from this planet, gain 1 command token.
This planet has a red technology specialty; if this planet already has a technology specialty, this planet's resource and influence values are each increased by 1 instead.

industrial.effect: You may gain 2 commodities, or you may convert up to 2 of your commodities to trade goods.
This planet has a green technology specialty; if this planet already has a technology specialty, this planet's resource and influence values are each increased by 1 instead.
This planet has a yellow technology specialty; if this planet already has a technology specialty, this planet's resource and influence values are each increased by 1 instead.
You may gain 1 commodity, or you may spend 1 trade good or 1 commodity to draw 1 action card.
Purge 3 of your industrial relic fragments to gain 1 relic.
You may gain 1 commodity, or you may spend 1 trade good or 1 commodity to place 1 mech from your reinforcements on this planet.
This planet has a blue technology specialty; if this planet already has a technology specialty, this planet's resource and influence values are each increased by 1 instead.

frontier.effect: Place this card faceup in your play area. ACTION: You may spend 6 resources and purge this card to research 1 technology.
Place a gamma wormhole token in this system. Then, purge this card.

Place the ion storm token in this system with either side faceup. Then, place this card in the common play area. At the end of the 'Move Ships' or 'Retreat' substep of a tactical action during which 1 or more of your ships use the ion storm wormhole, flip the ion storm token to its opposing side.
You may replenish your commodities, or you may convert your commodities to trade goods.
Place the Mirage planet token in this system. Gain the Mirage planet card and ready it. Then, purge this card.
This card counts as a relic fragment of any type.

relics.effect: Before you move units during a tactical action, you may purge this card to move and transport units that are in systems that contain 1 your command tokens.
At the start of the agenda phase, you may purge this card and exhaust all of your planets to gain any 1 technology.
When you would spend a token from your strategy pool, you may exhaust this card to spend a token from your reinforcements instead.

When you gain this card, gain 1 victory point; when you lose this card, lose 1 victory point. When a player gains control of a legendary planet you control or a planet you control in your home system, that player gains this card.

Choose 1 non-home, non-legendary planet other than Mecatol Rex in a system that is adjacent to 1 or more of your units that have Bombardment; destroy all units on that planet and purge its attachments and its planet card. Then, place the destroyed planet token on that planet and purge this card.
Purge this card to take up to 3 action cards of your choice from the action card discard pile.

After you perform a tactical action, you may exhaust this card to explore 1 planet you control. At the end of the status phase, if you control the 'Tomb of Emphidia', you may purge this card to gain 1 victory point.
During each combat round, this card's owner may reroll any number of their dice, applying +1 to the results; any units that reroll dice but do not produce at least 1 hit are destroyed.
When you gain this card, draw 1 secret objective. You can have 1 additional scored or unscored secret objective.
When you research a technology, you may exhaust this card to ignore 1 prerequisite or draw 1 action card.

secret.id: Learn the Secrets of the Cosmos
Make an Example of Their World
Master of the Laws of Physics
Occupy the Seat of the Empire

promissory.effect: When the [color of card] player replenishes commodities: The [color of card] player gives you all of his commodities. Then, return this card to the [color of card] player.

When an agenda is revealed: The [color of card] player cannot vote, play action cards, or use faction abilities until after that agenda is resolved. Then, return this card to the [color of card] player.

After the [color of card] player activates a system that contains 1 or more of your units: The [color of card] player cannot move units into the active system. Then, return this card to the [color of card] player.

When you receive this card, if you are not the [color of card] player, you must place it faceup in your play area and gain 1 victory point. If you activate a system that contains 1 or more of the [color of card] player's units, or if the [color of card] player is eliminated, lose 1 victory point and return this card to the [color of card] player.

When you receive this card, if you are not the (color) player, you must place it face up in your play area. While this card is in your play area, you can use the (color) player's commander ability, if it is unlocked. If you activate a system that contains 1 or more of the (color) player's units, return this card to the (color) player
